results.title: Premorbid use of selective beta-blockers improves sepsis incidence and course: Human cohort and animal model studies
results.text_hl: To the best of our knowledge, this is the first study showing the beneficial effects of selective beta-blockers, particularly @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, on @<m>DISEASE_Sepsis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018805 @@@sepsis@@@.

citations.NLM: Hong SY, Lai CC, Teng NC, Chen CH, Hsu CC, Chan NJ, Wang CY, Wang YH, Lin YS, Chen L. Premorbid use of selective beta-blockers improves sepsis incidence and course: Human cohort and animal model studies Front Med (Lausanne). 2023;10():1105894. PMID: 37144032
citations.BibTeX: @article{37144032, title={Premorbid use of selective beta-blockers improves sepsis incidence and course: Human cohort and animal model studies}, author={Hong SY and Lai CC and Teng NC and Chen CH and Hsu CC and Chan NJ and Wang CY and Wang YH and Lin YS and Chen L}, journal={Front Med (Lausanne)}, volume={10}, pages={1105894}}

results.title: Heart Rate Control during Experimental Sepsis in Mice: Comparison of Ivabradine and beta-Blockers.
results.text_hl: There was no difference in survival 60 h after @<m>DISEASE_Sepsis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018805 @@@sepsis@@@ induction with @CHEMICAL_Ivabradine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077550 @@@ivabradine@@@ (6 of 20, 30%) or @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (7 of 20, 35%), as compared with placebo (5 of 20, 25%; P = 0.224).

citations.NLM: Bedet A, Voiriot G, Ternacle J, Marcos E, Adnot S, Derumeaux G, Mekontso Dessap A. Heart Rate Control during Experimental Sepsis in Mice: Comparison of Ivabradine and beta-Blockers. Anesthesiology. 2020 Feb;132(2):321-329. PMID: 31939847
citations.BibTeX: @article{31939847, title={Heart Rate Control during Experimental Sepsis in Mice: Comparison of Ivabradine and beta-Blockers.}, author={Bedet A and Voiriot G and Ternacle J and Marcos E and Adnot S and Derumeaux G and Mekontso Dessap A}, journal={Anesthesiology}, volume={132}, number={2}, pages={321-329}}

results.title: Single-cell Sequence Analysis Combined with Multiple Machine Learning to Identify Markers in Sepsis Patients: LILRA5.
results.text_hl: Molecular docking results demonstrated the possibility of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ targeting @GENE_LILRA5 @GENE_353514 @@@LILRA5@@@ for the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Sepsis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018805 @@@sepsis@@@.

citations.NLM: Ning J, Fan X, Sun K, Wang X, Li H, Jia K, Ma C. Single-cell Sequence Analysis Combined with Multiple Machine Learning to Identify Markers in Sepsis Patients: LILRA5. Inflammation. 2023 Mar 15;():. PMID: 36920635
